column5: When I was a wee one, me mudder would make squigly wigilys. Ok it was rotoni,but it was funny to say.We were kids after all. I made a dish tonight from the squiggly. Baked  chicken marinara squiggly.  Dinner for two.  Were off to eat now.    Walleyejigger,get yer head out of the oven.LOL
Looks tasty. Pasta casserole was a  staple fer us as kids, too. Usually rotini or seashells.
you are quite the chef Boy ( ar dee!)  TB
Looks good Brian  ...I made something similar the other night!!....
When we were kids,there wasnt a big enough pot to make this stuff.  Remember when Bravo came in a jar.LOL
That fatboy, has nothing on me.LOL
My kids call it 'pasta al forno', or 'oven pasta' and prefer the penne to the rotini.  But, they're my kids - how did they turn out Italian?
Im guessing it was the sausigga?                              LOL
Mmmmm, pasghetti!!!!  That looks really tasty B.  I think you should send me that recipe  Joey
Where's the collard greens, cornbread, and black eyed peas???

Scubetti.  It's really the melted toasty cheese on top that really gets ya.  Brian, start mixing it up, with some sharp cheddar, provolone or parmigian, a little at a time.  That Resident Love Goddess will come around.  Brian, I'm thinking it was the figa, not the cazzo that made em that way..
